item.title: Adopters
item.description: The following projects adopt the Code of Merit: Apprentice Bot - Transcribers Of Reddit awesome-django bestbuy-php Calculadora bin Cropper for Rails EZ-WifiBroadcast faker.js go-api go-api-router go-cache go-pipl go-sanitize Juego del ahorcado LaTeX.js LCDproc log4net.Appender.Splunk Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Splunk NYU Bobst Library Reservation Automator OAuthLibâ€™s open-paperless PASSY PHP Bencode Encoder/Decoder Project Importer Risk Management Module rivetsjs-stdlib RxDock TamedRespawn The Unofficial Marvel PHP Library Transcribers Of Reddit (core) xlsx-parser

item.title: Code of Merit
item.description: The project creators, lead developers, core team, constitute the managing members of the project and have final say in every decision of the project, technical or otherwise, including overruling previous decisions. There are no limitations to this decisional power. Contributions are an expected result of your membership on the project. Don't expect others to do your work or help you with your work forever. All members have the same opportunities to seek any challenge they want within the project.

item.title: License
item.description: The Code of Merit, originally created by Roberto Rosario, is released under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Public License (CC-BY 4.0 for short). Unless otherwise noted, all content of this website is released under the same license. CC-BY 4.0 is: A Free Culture License. A free software license, although usage for software programs is not advised. In short, if some work is under CC-BY you can share it in any medium or format and adapt it for any purpose, even commercial, as long as you follow the license terms, which include providing an appropriate attribution.
